The Purdue womens basketball team defeated the Colgate Raiders  in Mackey Arena on Sunday PERIOD

Purdue  junior guard Andreona Keys had a massive performance with  while shooting a . average PERIOD Her early scoring helped the Boilers to hold a lead throughout the game PERIOD

 head coach Sharon Versyp said PERIOD

Senior point guard Ashley Morrissette was a vocal leader tonight helping set up big plays for the Boilers PERIOD Her seven points  assists and five steals helped keep the momentum for the Boilers PERIOD

 Morrissette said PERIOD

Sophomore forward Dominique McBryde ended with nine points and  rebounds coming close to a doubledouble PERIOD

Colgate  had only one player in double figures  guard Katie Curtis who finished with  PERIOD

Next up for Purdue is hosting Central Michigan  at  p.m PERIOD Tuesday in Mackey Arena PERIOD

GAME NOTES

 Purdue had two players in doubledigit rebounding  McBryde and Keys with  each PERIOD

 Purdues defense held Colgate to . percent shooting in the second half  and . percent for the game 

 The Boilermakers shot a seasonlow . percent at the free throw line 

 Colgate matched a Purdue opponent record making zero free throws marking the fourth time in program history an opponent hasnt scored from the stripe and first since Dec PERIOD   at Green Bay
